alert.note: Alert for Talladega (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 4:52PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Talladega and southwestern Calhoun Counties through 530 PM CDT... At 452 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Talladega Superspeedway, or 11 miles east of Pell City, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... West End-Cobb Town, Lincoln, Munford, Talladega Superspeedway, Honda Manufacturing Of Alabama, Bynum, Talladega Municipal Airport, Logan Martin Lake, Anniston Army Depot, Eastaboga and Jackson Shoals. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
